taxon_identification.name_authority_date: Setaria pumila subsp. pallidefusca (Schumach.) B.K. Simon

bio:treatment.description: Blades dark green. Bristles reddish. Spikelets 2-2.5 mm. 2n = 18, 36, 54, 72.
bio:treatment.discussion: Setaria pumila subsp. pallidefusca is native to tropical Africa. It is now established as a weed in southÂ¬eastern Louisiana, but it has also been collected in the past on ballast dumps in Portland, Oregon. Reports of S. nigrirostris (Nees) T Durand & Schinz in North America have not been verified. It differs from S. pumila in being a rhizomatous perennial with spikelets 3.5-5 mm long and bristles with thickened tips (those of S. pumila are slender throughout). It is a native of southern Africa.
